Ruby - Access a module like an array

24 Apr 2012

I found a cool way to access a module like an array:

self:: enables you to treat the whole module like an array. You could then say Fruits0 and it would show the element at the index 0, which is “Banana”. Very handy!

Hint: Instead of using self:: you could also use self.. However the former is cleaner to read in my opinion.
